Key Match Events: Will Benson hit a three-run homer to right field, his first homer since July 29 and his 13th of the season.
Oakland scored twice in the top of the seventh inning to take a 5-0 lead, but the Reds battled back with six runs in the bottom of the seventh.
Post-Match Reflections: Reliever Fernando Cruz said, "We lost it together. It's nobody's fault."
Reds manager David Bell said, "It all matters, especially when it's a hit or homer that helps your team come back and take a lead."
Reliever Emilio Pag√°n said, "I made, in my opinion, an inexcusable mistake."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds dropped to a 63-70 record and 10 games back for the final National League Wild Card spot.
The Reds had completed a three-game sweep of the Cardinals and were just one game below.500 only two weeks ago.
Others: Reds manager David Bell emphasized the importance of Will Benson's hit, saying it's "important to Will. He wants to do well. He also wants to help the team win."
